metadata.Title: CVE-2020-15989 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium
metadata.Description:
Uninitialized data in PDFium in Google Chrome prior to 86.0.4240.75 alloweda remote attacker to obtain potentially sensitive information from processmemory via a crafted PDF file.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-15989` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 86.0.4240.75-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-browser-l10n - 86.0.4240.75-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-chromedriver - 86.0.4240.75-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 86.0.4240.75-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 86.0.4240.75-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '86.0.4240.75-0ubuntu0.18.04.1').
